item.title: Question: Help me identify these bugs in my house.?
item.description: I have all these tiny, brown, hard shell looking bugs in my house. They look like they are split down the middle but I have not caught one of them flying. We have only noticed them these last two summers and my dad seems to think they are caused by a giant weed that looks like s tree growing right up against my house we just haven't had the chance to remove it. Most of them are located right between the wooden door frame and the door which happens to be located right behind the plant. They are found mostly on the walls and ceiling. I've looked up photos of bedbugs hoping that is not what they are and it seems to look like they aren't. Bedbugs have a redish tint to them while these bugs are dark brown/black. Please help me, I have told my dad that we should call pest control but he wants to solve it on his own. I have not been able to take a photo of them this year because my main concern was trying to get rid of them but I have a photo I sent to my dad last summer but it may not let me post it. Thank you for any information in advance!!

I checked it again one week later and all the screws and the input of the channel next to it was puffy and green as well and has made the paint of the amp peel off, and when the paint came off there was a white milky liquid that was underneath. Question: Should I get a bunny?
item.description: My friend has baby bunnies and I want to get one but I want to know if I would be a good fit. I'm soon to be 18 and still in high school and going to live with my patents until after college (Gonna be a vet tech). I've had rabbits before when I was younger but none for a few years. I would get a cage for it to go in when I'm not not (for school or work) and night but when I'm home it would be able to run around in the "fence" I would buy. I would make sure it had at least two hours a day of being able to run around. I also have two dogs and a cat but the dogs would never be alone with it even when it's in the cage. No small children in the house. We're all over 13 and I would do my research to make sure it had the proper food and toys and such but I just want to know if it would be okay with being in the cage. It would be given attention and I'd litter train it. Also would get it fixed when the times comes. Would it be okay? Thanks!

item.title: Question: Are my pants appropriate or too casual?
item.description:
I'm starting a new job soon and even though they gave me dress instructions, I'm still confused. I have these black pants from Nautica (see link) and want to know if they will be appropriate. The following is an excerpt from the dress code:
"'business-appropriate' clothing is acceptableand encouraged. For men, such clothing includes collared-dress shirts, khaki-type slacks, closed-toe shoes, and socks. Unacceptable attire includes denim, sports logo wear, athletic or 'athleisure' clothing such as leggings, golf/polo shirts, capri pants, sandals, miniskirts, or other revealing clothing."
I'm concerned the rivets and pockets of these pants might not fit the criteria. However, I think when I wear a nice button down shirt, belt, and dress shoes it will look good. Please help.
http://www.nautica.com/slim-fit-stretch-5-pocket-pant/PR7120.html?dwvar_PR7120_color=085#uuid=0f8f81102055ef6157ea01e68a

item.title: Question: Will anthurium bloom again?
Question: Gardening Experts: Is it okay to plant peonies here?
item.description:
My house faces east. The south side of my house has a door into a large breezeway, maybe 15 feet wide. To the south of the breezeway is a two-car attached garage with two separate single garage doors, not one big one, so it's a big garage. I want to plant peonies along the outside of the south wall of my garage, which gets plenty of sun.
I know peonies attract ants. Ants are how they pollinate. But because of they attract ans, people have said I shouldn't plant them along my house.
My question is is that really too close to my house. I mean, it's right up against my house, but it's the attached garage on the other side of an attached breezeway, both of which are outside rooms. It's a good 40 to 50 feet from the actual inside of my house.
Is that too close? Would I be inviting ants? Also, my house is limestone. Would there be an issue of the rocks heating up too much from the direct sun for the peonies? I don't think so because peonies seem to thrive in direct sun and heat, but I just wanted to check. Oh, and when should peonies be planted? Is it a spring planting or a fall planting or can I do it now?

I'm only 125 so if it's weak for me it will be weak for my pups. I'm also moving out in a year and dont want to put to mucn money into something thats not going to stay with. Is there any way to make it safe to walk on. Let the dogs sun bath out on it have a nice little sitting spot with plants and humming bird feeders. Question: Help with hair removal on my neck and chest?
item.description:
A couple of years back, I began shaving my neck because a friend of mine said I had long dark hairs, and I was embarrassed. I also began shaving my chest not long after. I regretted it immediately, but it was too late to turn back.
My issue is that my neck always has either red or black bumps after shaving, and it looks really bad. To avoid this on my chest, I started plucking the dark hairs, only for there to be red, pimple-like bumps all over it. item.title: Question: Why did the Liberal Party of Australia call themselves liberal?
item.description:
I have done a little bit of reading about the party and they formed in 1945 to apparently combat the spread of socialism and communism. It's strange that Australia went that route because after WW2 the UK became more socialist. The first elected government after the Second World War introduced the NHS (National Health Service) largely as a way to make sure everyone who fought in the war and the families who were affected had free access to the health care that they required. Australia didn't really do a lot of fighting in the war and were relatively unharmed so the need for free health care probably wasn't as pressing for them.
Despite claiming to be economically liberal, the Liberal Party has introduced more protectionist policies and interventionism than any other government in Australia and are fervently conservative in social aspects. It was the ALP that started TPP negotiations that would have potentially liberated trade between some of the largest world markets.
Despite the Liberal's best efforts to restrict socialism, socialist healthcare was introduced in Australia in 1975. It was called Medibank initially but is now known as Medicare, and has near universal approval. This not only helped Australians at home but also abroad because it lead to Reciprocal Health Care Agreements with the United Kingdom and ten other countries entitling Australian residents to reciprocal free health care rights while in one of these countries.
In short, the Liberals are not liberal.

item.title: Question: Is my diet ok for a 15 year old girl?
item.description:
I'm 158cm tall & weigh 48.5kg. I'm kinda trying to get down to around 45kg (maybe less). I know I'm a healthy weight but I have quite a lot of fat on me. Lately I've been avoiding certain foods more than usual and feeling a bit guilty after eating them. I feel totally fine but am worried that if I don't eat enough I'll harm myself in the long run. At the same time, though I feel kinda bad about myself if I eat over like 1250 calories. I've just generally been stressing about food & calories & stuff quite a bit lately & would like some opinions on my diet.
Breakfast: 45g of cereal with a bit of milk or scrambled eggs on a piece of toast (200-ish calories) Lunch: a super grains bar (115 calories) or a banana (100-ish calories) or a piece of toast with peanut butter ( 180-ish calories) Tea: about 1/2 a 9" plate of stirfry/roast vegetables, 1/4 of beans & some kind of vegetarian meat or 1/4 of potato/kumara (450/500-ish calories) or bulgur wheat salad (400-ish calories) Snack: a green apple/a kiwifruit & like 5 pecans/almonds (150-ish calories) The calories might be way off since I don't measure everything, I just make an educated guess.
I rock climb 1-3 times a week & take at least 5000 steps most days btw (:

item.description: My friend has baby bunnies and I want to get one but I want to know if I would be a good fit. I'm soon to be 18 and still in high school and going to live with my patents until after college (Gonna be a vet tech). I've had rabbits before when I was younger but none for a few years. I would get a cage for it to go in when I'm not not (for school or work) and night but when I'm home it would be able to run around in the "fence" I would buy. The cage would not be a tiny one it would have enough room to lay down and it would be tall enough for it to stand up. I would make sure it had at least two hours a day of being able to run around. It would have as much as possible like all night after school if I don't work and also much of the time on the weekends and also if my brothers decide to play with it if they want when I'm not home. I also have two dogs and a cat but the dogs would never be alone with it even when it's in the cage. No small children in the house. We're all over 13 and I would do my research to make sure it had the proper food and toys and such but I just want to know if it would be okay with being in the cage. It would be given attention and I'd litter train it. Also would get it fixed when the times comes. I'm also up for recommendations on what to get and some tips on care. item.title: Question: I have different answers. I would love to hear your answer in a one succinct paragraph?
item.description:
Two people return to their long neglected garden and find among the weeds a few of the old plants surprisingly vigorous. One says to the other, "It must be that a gardener has been coming and doing something about these plants.” Upon inquiry they find that no neighbor has ever seen anyone at work in their garden. The first man says to the other, "He must have worked while people slept." The other says, "No, someone would have heard him and besides, anybody who cared about the plants would have kept down these weeds." The first man says, "Look at the way these are arranged. There is purpose and a feeling for beauty here. I believe that someone comes, someone invisible to mortal eyes. I believe that the more carefully we look the more we shall find confirmation of this." They examine the garden ever so carefully and sometimes they come on new things suggesting that a gardener comes and sometimes they come on new things suggesting the contrary and even that a malicious person has been at work. Besides examining the garden carefully, they also study what happens to gardens left without attention. Each learns all the other learns about this and about the garden. Consequently, when after all this, one says, "I still believe a gardener comes," while the other says, "I don't,"
What is the difference between them?

Question: How to care for our new kitty?
item.description: About a week ago my boyfriend and I found a cat laying in the middle of the road, presumably hit by a car. My boyfriend has had a couple of pets killed by cars, and now as a result he moves roadkill animals off the road so no pet owner has to deal with the headache of scraping their pet off the pavement the way he has. However when he got out to move this kitty he was still alive. Unable to afford the vet bill, we took him to the overnight drop box at out local shelter and came back to see if he made it the next day. Now a week later he's bounced back and can walk, run, jump, and eat on his own. The girls at the shelter have been asking us about adopting him and we think it's a lovely idea. However, the damage done to him after getting hit has left him with a head tilt. Because of this we've affectionately given him the name Wybie, after the little boy from the movie Coraline who walk around with his head tilted to the side like our kitty. He can walk, run, and jump, but he can't do it straight. How can we care for our little Wybie the best we can given his disability?

I can't even motivate myself to do my laundry or clean my apartment half the time. All I ever want to do is drink, play video games. I've lost interest in guitar playing, one of my strings broke and I can't bring myself to drive to the music store and buy new strings, the only thing I ever spend my money on is beer almost every night. My dad rides me all the time about how I never do anything except drink and sit on the computer. I realize that these are all problems but I can't bring myself to fix them. My dad thinks it's just because I'm a lazy piece of you know what. I told him the I would kill him, and of course I didn't actually mean it, I was just mad at the time I don't actually want to kill him and he pretty much resents me now. He told me that if my other 2 brothers stopped talking to him it would bother him, but if I stopped talking to him it wouldn't bother him one bit. I don't think it's because I'm lazy I think they're more deep rooted issues that are going on with me, and I don't know what to do. I'm considering seeking professional help, I don't know whether to do outpatient therapy or impatient. My lifestyle right now has become unmanageable and I need help.

You are on pain medication which works most of the time but you will always regret lifting something heavy, most exercises, and all but very gentle sex.The only thing left is to have it removed BUT the doctors give you a 50/50 chance that the pain will continue as "ghost pain" and nothing further could be done. item.title: Question: Is this intriguing for the start of a book? (Without knowing anything)?
item.description: When she inhaled, she tasted the blood gushing from her upper lip, but she swallowed it, and kept walking down the dark alleyway, clutching the tiny piece of paper in her fingertips. “718 Ash Street,” she whispered, and flinched as she spoke to herself. She coughed- more blood, but she ignored it, and navigated around the broken glass on the sidewalk. Her designer heels were long gone, ditched at least five miles ago. The train of her long silver gown trailed on the ground, the tulle completely tattered and blackened from dirt. The thin material of the silk waist flapped open, exposing her bruised stomach. Her hyperventilating quickened with the headlights of each passing car, as she ducked in the shadows to stay hidden.

I apologize for the gross and personal nature of this post, but I ve searched everywhere and can t seem to find an answer.
I had my gallbladder removed about four years ago, and ever since then, I ve had to go to the bathroom urgently and do my business (which usually ends up in small amounts of diarrhea). Even now, right after eating, or even in the middle of eating, I get the urge to go, and when I do it s a small amount of diarrhea.
I do not have any abdominal pain, fever, or any other symptoms. It doesn t matter what I eat, everything makes me feel this way. I do not take laxatives, I m not allergic to anything, and do not have any other symptoms besides what I stated before. Should I go to a doctor, or is an uncommon side effect that I shouldn t worry about? Are there any ideas how I can lighten the frequency, or make it stop altogether?
Side note - I do have "solid" bathroom trips, but only when I eat a lot of meat. Not sure if that helps or not.
Thank you to all who help with this, or have similar experiences

item.title: Question: Do you think I could be a foreign host?
item.description: I'm a young guy who's barely in my twenties, and I was thinking of learning Japanese, and to start living my life in Japan once I'm fluent. To begin my dreams of living in Japan, I thought about starting off as a host at a host club. In Japan, it's not uncommon for Japanese women to pay guys huge sums of money for a couple of cocktails and a few hours of platonic companionship. The key is to be attractive, and to lure in women. I think I have an advantage because I'm foreign. However, to be honest, I'm not the greatest at picking up women because I'm introverted, but I could still make it possible for women to enjoy my presence, since I never had trouble in that area. A description about myself, I'm half French and half Mexican, so I have black hair, but somewhat tanned skin (hazel eyes). I have a swimmer's built, and quite skinny, but I have good muscular definition. I have a youthful face, so I look younger than my real age. As for my overall appearance towards women, I have had two or three random women come to my job just to see me in the past. Anyways, it's not an ideal job (hosting and all), but I think it's better than the other typical jobs as a foreigner (like teaching English to a classroom full of people).

Radiator is having behavior problems with this texas 100 degree heat.First yesterday i found there to be barely any coolant and the worst part was the over flow resevoire was extremely bad spraying anti freeze all over the battery. the level on the reservoir read (MIN).Today i drove it and it was spraying pretty damn bad but tonight i put a ton of anti freeze and the spraying has stopped i have not drove the truck but let it idle and heat up and all seem fine BUT there is leaking from something the passenger tire was very wet and i felt around the radiator and the radiator has a very strong heat AROUND THE RADIATOR HOSE.I also discovered STEEL HOSE LINE PREETY WET AND NOT LEAKING BUT PREETY DAMN WET for me not driving it for a few days.and i think the steel hose goes to radiator.As far as the major leak from somewhere that leaks on my tire i cannot really pin point other thinking its either a hose or the radiator but the radiator doesn't have significant bleeding i men its wet but it stops making me think its my own mess from pouring the anti freeze.
OH WELL I GUESS IN THE MORNING I WILL FIND A PUDDLE.
Picture below shows steel hose thats not dripping but WET.(top hose) FOUND MAJOR LEAK went on tire on passenger side seems the resevoir hose to the radiator is disconnected pouring out much anti freeze.So i guess what happened was hose poured out my anti freeze and I'm not sure why yesterday anti freeze started spraying out like crazy maybe its because the radiator had no anti freeze while i was driving thus making engine extremely hot.Im lucky i didn't ruin anything but i will find out tomorrow i doubt any damage.

item.title: [ Religion & Spirituality ] Open Question : Why did God resort to killing the Egyptian firstborn, but only the firstborn of Egypt (Exodus 12:29)?
item.description:
(1) Since Pharaoh hardened his heart and refused to allow the Israelites to go out of Egypt - He ignored God's every warning to let his people go out of Egypt in regards to the previous 9 plagues (Exodus 7-12).
(2) God would be unjust if he had not punished the Egyptians in response to the genocide of the Jews in Exodus 1:22 - The doctrine of eye for eye is due process, which requires the punishment to fit the nature of the crime (Exodus 21:24).
(3) Although the Egyptians were all guilty of genocide (Exodus 12:29) God had no choice but to exercise restraint by killing only the firstborn of Egypt - Which was due process in retaliation for the genocide of the Jews in Exodus 1:22 - l'est all hell should break loose and Pharaoh would've lost any semblance of restraint in his dealings with the Israelites - So it was a matter of expedience that God was restrained in response to the genocide of the Jews in Exodus 1:22.
So, now do you see why God resorted to killing the Egyptian firstborn, whilst exercising restraint in response to the genocide of the Jews in Exodus 1:22?

item.description: So this guy and Ihave gotten very close these past 6 weeks, we attended a summer college get together and that's how we met. While we were at the college group camp we hun out a lot and talked every day about the camp and activities we did. It was so fun. He even paid for my ticket to go to schlitterbahn nad before I left camp he have made a huge box of goldfish (that's both our favorite snack). We've stayed in touch ever since. So as a thank you for what he did for me I sent him a giant box of goldfish in the mail, as something fun just to show how much I appreciated what he did. When he received it he messaged me saying how it meant so much to him, how he would write me a letter back and how it was the nicest thing anyone has ever done for him. All through out the day he just kept messaging me thanking me for it and how it meant so much, Do you think he really meant that?

item.title: [ Other - Careers & Employment ] Open Question : Quiting a job advise?
item.description: So I started a apprentiship for machining and thought that I would really enjoy it. After working for about 4 months I came to realize that I really do not like it and I want out. My boss thinks that after I finish my first class I'm going to continue on learning for 4 more years and working there long term. I decided I want to quit because of so many reasons I can't even count. I don't fit in with the machinest environment, unhealthy and unsafe ect. What is the best way to tell my boss this, I feel like he will be disappointed that he took me in the first place. I know for sure almost this is not what I want to do so I'm not planning on just sticking through it my whole life.

item.title: [ Primary & Secondary Education ] Open Question : Should I stay or move to a new state to finish my senior year of high school?
item.description: I'm currently trying to decide on whether to move to a new state, or stay at my home state for my senior year of high school. At home, I have all my friends, I know the school and everyone in it, and I know the place. However, my family there ain't the greatest to me. My mom and sister both gang up on me and the whole situation there isn't the greatest. In the state I'm thinking of moving to, I know no one but my dads girlfriend and her kids. I don't know the area all that well, I've visited the school that I would be going to if I did stay and kind of like it, the teachers at my other school sucked, I feel slightly more comfortable here than at my home state because I'm not being attacked by my family 24/7, but all of my really close friends are back at home.I don't know what to decide. All of my close friends are saying that they'll support my decision. Is there anything that can help make my decision easier or have any advice for me?

Question: Uncontrollable body odor. help!! effecting life. (suicidal)?
item.description:
long story short I am a dancer. I never had this problem up until about 2 years ago(I m 20 yr old male now) . its really not a problem until I start to sweat extremely-in long tense rehearsals that last for more than 2 hrs. p.s I been through puberty. 12
I understand its the bacteria that comes in when the skin is soaked with sweat which makes sense because after I stop activity for a bit I smell fine including the clothes I take off.
my daily routine ever since this problem: at night I wash (dove soap), put clinical deodorant (dove) on I wake up stretch( in which I sweat get in the shower and put good quality deodorant on (dove). I tried different deodorants that are not like powder doesn t work for me
this caused so much stress on my life I literally had suicidal thoughts cause of some of the bullying. I became a vegetarian for several months. and recently I stopped eating sugar for days. because it came out of no where. I m seeing a doctor soon I honestly feel helpless and I just don t know... my life is dark rn. can any of you help? products? doing something wrong? Is there a way I can lessen the bacteria and or sweat. I don t want to lose opportunities because of this
